The dialog should present information like that -  You need "Manage Sprints" or *"Edit sprints"* permission ....

not exist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira's DVCS webhooks respond with the HTTP 500 error and the error message *{{There is already an active ThreadEventsCapture}}*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Could not reproduce

h3. Expected Results
The webhooks reaching {{/rest/bitbucket/1.0/webhook/github}} are processed normally.

h3. Actual Results
The processing fails for some threads.

Enabling the {{com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs}} package as {{DEBUG}}, we can see the messages in the logs:
{noformat}
2021-05-21 17:07:16,075+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-52 DEBUG anonymous 102x1234x5 - X.X.X.X /rest/bitbucket/1.0/webhook/github [c.a.j.p.d.r.external.v1.HookResource] Received GitHub pull_request event
2021-05-21 17:07:16,076+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-52 DEBUG anonymous 102x1234x5 - X.X.X.X /rest/bitbucket/1.0/webhook/github [c.a.j.p.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl] Finding repository with URL [https://github.com/myorg/myrepo] for organization [22]
2021-05-21 17:07:16,090+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-52 DEBUG anonymous 102x1234x5 - X.X.X.X /rest/bitbucket/1.0/webhook/github [c.a.j.p.d.r.external.v1.HookResource] Failed to execute web-hook
java.lang.IllegalStateException: There is already an active ThreadEventsCapture
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.event.ThreadEvents.startCapturing(ThreadEvents.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.rest.webhook.GitHubHookProcessor.processPullRequest(GitHubHookProcessor.java:231)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.rest.webhook.GitHubHookProcessor.lambda$savePullRequest$5(GitHubHookProcessor.java:221)
	at java.base/java.util.Optional.ifPresent(Optional.java:183)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.rest.webhook.GitHubHookProcessor.savePullRequest(GitHubHookProcessor.java:221)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.rest.external.v1.HookResource.handlePullRequestEvent(HookResource.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.rest.external.v1.HookResource.lambda$githubHookEndpoint$2(HookResource.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.rest.external.v1.HookResource.handleRequest(HookResource.java:156)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.rest.external.v1.HookResource.githubHookEndpoint(HookResource.java:116)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Enable the following [dark feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html]:
{noformat}
dvcs.connector.polling.synchronization.enabled
{noformat}

fields.description:
This is regarding  [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-938846963.html]

 
 When the backup from Cloud is taken (for server) and restore it to the server, the attachments are not automatically restored in to the destination location. 
  
 Restore process will not take care of restoring the attachment and manually user need to copy the attachments to the JIRA-HOME/data/attachments folder
  
 This step is not explicitly mentioned in the document...
  
 The statement related to attachment is
{panel:title=Import your data from JIRA Cloud into JIRA Server}
If your backup is 2 GB or more, import the attachments separately

For large backups, we recommend that the attachments are imported separately. To do this:
 # Unzip the backup file.
 # Compress the {{activeobjects.xml}} and the {{entities.xml}} files only.
 # Import the compressed file in the setup wizard, as described above.
 # Copy the contents of the {{attachments}} directory into the {{<home-directory>/data/attachments}} directory for JIRA Server.{panel}
Hence for smaller backup&restore operation customer expecting the attachments should automatically available at destination location after restore operation. But instead they see the attachment missing error in JIra.

Additional information:

When taking backup in Server the attachment wont be part of it, so user always need to take the backup separately and restore (copy) to the destination

But in Cloud we have an option to include attachments, avatar etc inside the attachment. So it is always recommended user need to extract the data folder and copy it to the destination
fields.summary: Handling Attachments while Cloud->Server restore

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users can make mistakes and might have filled an incorrect value for the Story Points, only perceived later on, when the velocity of the team was affected. 
 Fixing the story points will fix the Velocity however the Burndown Report for the affected Sprint will lose the history.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a sprint "mySprint2", assign some estimated issues (total of 8 points), and activate the sprint;
 2. Create a new issue adding the story points= 229679 and assigning it to the Sprint "mySprint2", causing a scope change
 3. Mark the issue as Done;
 4. Complete the sprint, moving the incomplete issues to a new sprint;
 5. Observe the history of the sprint:
 - The scope change when the issue with 229679 was added,
 - The remaining estimated points for the sprint changing from 8 to 229687 points;
 - The moment when the issue was marked as done;
 - The new remaining estimated points back to 8;
 - The moment when the sprint was marked as complete, showing all done issues with estimated points 0 and the final remaining points
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-20 at 12.07.49.png|width=695,height=318!

6. After a while, someone observed the error at the story points and how it was affecting the Team Velocity, so the value was changed from 229679 to 2;
h3. Expected Results
 - Burndown reporting the story points change from 229679 to 2 and the sprint size adjusted. 
 !SUGGESTED_OUTPUT.png|width=695,height=318!

h3. Actual Results
 - The scope change when the issue was added is not more showing 229679, it is showing 0. We can not know that this sprint was modified AFTER it was closed and that the story points of the issue changed from 229679 to 2. 
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-20 at 12.14.02.png|width=695,height=318!

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing Story Points after Sprint was marked as complete affects Burndown Report history of events

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Gitlab integration configuration in Jira currently takes any string you type into the "Team or User Account" field without validating the configuration works. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure OAUTH 2.0 for Gitlab.
# Navigate to *Administration > DVCS Accounts* and click "Link an account"
# Toggle "Host" field to GitLab Self-Managed, or GitLab.
# Type any random text you want into the "Team or User Account" field.
# Save the configuration and observe it is successful. 

h3. Expected Results
Configuration should be validated prior to allowing you to save it to prevent invalid configuration. 

h3. Actual Results
The field takes whatever you type in.  

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Add Input Validation in DVCS Configuration Page for Gitlab Option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Gitlab integration currently only supports adding Groups in the configuration. It would be nice if this functionality also supported the option to use a User account as well. There's even an API for it:

https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/projects.html#list-user-projects


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Administration > DVCS Accounts* and click "Link an account"
# Toggle "Host" field to GitLab Self-Managed, or GitLab.
# Observe that the field you need to input a Group has the text of "Team or User Account".

h3. Expected Results
An option to toggle to user based connection which would switch from groups to user api backed calls to Gitlab.

h3. Actual Results
The field expects a Group account. 

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: DVCS Integration For Gitlab should support User Accounts in addition to existing Groups Functionality

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently when you select Gitlab type of DVCS connector the configuration UI states that you should input "Team or User Account". As our Gitlab integration supports only using Groups this messaging is confusing. It would be great if the UI could toggle to better descriptive text that indicates the expected input rather than the generic text that exists for all types of DVCS endpoints.

!2021-05-19_16-56-29.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Administration > DVCS Accounts* and click "Link an account"
 # Toggle "Host" field to GitLab Self-Managed, or GitLab.
 # Observe that the field you need to input a Group has the text of "Team or User Account".

h3. Expected Results

The text should change from "Team or User Account" to "Group" with some description or link to how to find this information in GitLab.
h3. Actual Results

The field says "Team or User Account"
h3. Workaround

None. You just have to input Group account.
fields.summary: DVCS Configuration Text Should Ask for Group instead of "Team or User Account"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unauthenticated users can't open or download attached images on public projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in on Jira
 # Create a project
 # Set *Browse Projects* permission to *"Anyone on the web"*.
 # Create an issue with an attached image.
 # Copy the link to the issue (or the link of the attached image).
 # Open an incognito/private browser.
 # Paste the copied link and enter.

h3. Expected Results

The unauthenticated user should be able to see or download the attached image.
h3. Actual Results

When the pasted link is the link to the issue, the attachment preview appears broken.

When the pasted link is the image link, the user is redirected to the login page.
h3. Workaround

Logging in and then logging out solve the problem on that browser window.
fields.summary: unauthenticated users can't open or download attached images on public projects.

h3. Issue Summary
Jira Software REST API reference does not include documentation for archiving components action

See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72311

The REST API to *archive* a component exists, but it is not included in the rest api reference: https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.13.6/#api/2/component

Is this a documentation bug or an unpublished API? If it's a documentation bug then we should be able to close out that JAC ticket once the docs are updated.

# Go to the rest api docs for Jira software
# Search for component
# There is no archive component api documented

h3. Expected Results
# an archive component api endpoint is documented

h3. Actual Results
# no endpoint is documented

h3. Workaround
see See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72311

fields.description:
Currently, Epic Link field is locked in Jira and cannot be used as mandatory when moving tickets or other issue actions.

It would be useful if we could have the functionality to make the Epic Link field required out of the box (without the need to unlock the field in the Jira database).


h3. Workaround
The only way to perform make this field mandatory when moving issues, is by setting it as *Required* on the *target* field configuration scheme. Also, since it is *Locked*, is necessary to follow the below steps:
# Follow the steps on [Unlock a locked Jira Software custom field documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unlock-a-locked-jira-software-custom-field-779158866.html] to *unlock* the Epic Link field
# Go to *Cog icon -> Issues -> Field configurations*
# Click on the target project field configuration 
# Find the *Epic Link* field 
# Click on *Required*
# Follow the steps on [Unlock a locked Jira Software custom field documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unlock-a-locked-jira-software-custom-field-779158866.html] to *Lock* the field again
(!) Make sure to Lock the field again after performing the above steps.
fields.summary: Possibility to make Epic Link field required when moving ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a version in a project is released, issues with that version does not retain the last development activity done with the issue if there's additional development related changes to the issue after the version is released.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Integrate Jira with Bitbucket.
# Create an issue in Jira.
# Add a version to the issue.
# Commit a change to the issue.
# Create a pull request for the issue.
# Merge the change.
# At the development panel in issue view, users should see "<X> pull request MERGED".
# Release the issue associated with the issue.
# Navigate to Project -> Releases -> Select specific version. Under the "Development" tab, user will see that Jira shows "MERGED" for the issue.
# Trigger another commit for the issue.
# Refresh Version page and user see the information under the "Development" is changed to "X commit".

 !Screenshot 2021-05-11 at 10.23.41 AM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

Jira shows the last development activity related to the issue before the version was released.


h3. Actual Results

Jira shows the latest development activity related to the issue. Any new development related activity will be displayed in the version page.

Note:

In the issue navigator, Jira display the last development changes of the issue prior to the version was released:

 !Screenshot 2021-05-11 at 10.18.33 AM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Development tab in version page shows incorrect detail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Custom Field is set to be the board's Estimation Statistic, it is no longer available to be added to the Issue Detail View

This was probably an intentional decision, since a SCRUM board displays the content of the Estimation Custom Field at the top as *Estimate*, however, it is actually possible for a KANBAN board to have estimation set (should not be possible), and this results in the field not being displayed.

In any case, a customer may wish to have the custom field used for estimation displayed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a SCRUM board and a test issue
 # Create a numeric custom field, assign to project, and give the test issue a value
 # Configure the board, visit *Estimation*, and use the custom field as the estimation statistic
 # Refresh the configure board page
 # Click *Issue Detail View*

h3. Expected Results
 * The custom field can be added to the *Issue Detail View* under General fields
 * The field is returned via {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/detailviewfield/12345/available}}

h3. Actual Results
 * The custom field is removed from the list of fields to add
 * The field is not returned via {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/detailviewfield/12345/available}}


For customers having this problem on KANBAN board, you can confirm this is the cause by checking the {{editmodel.json}} response in browser Network Tools. Observe the  estimation statistic is configured for your problematic custom field:
{code:java}
},
  "estimationStatisticConfig": {
    "rapidViewId": 12345,
    "canEdit": true,
    "currentEstimationStatistic": {
      "typeId": "field",
      "fieldId": "customfield_13000",
      "id": "field_customfield_13000",
      "name": "Custom Field Name Here",
      "isValid": true,
      "isEnabled": true,
      "renderer": "number"
    }, {code}

h3. Workaround

*For SCRUM board:*
 # Set the estimation to Story Points
 # Refresh the configuration screen
 # Add the custom field to Issue Detail View
 # Change the estimation again to the Custom Field

*For KANBAN board:*
 # Make a new board via REST API, replacing the variables as required:
{code:java}
curl -vvv -X POST -u ADMIN_USER https://YOUR_JIRA/rest/agile/1.0/board --data '{"name":"New Board", "type":"kanban", "filterId":YOUR_FILTER_ID}' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' {code}
 # Visit the Project, then hover over the top left icon on the board, and select your new board
 # Reconfigure the board as per desire (EG, column mappings, subquery, etc)
 # Finally, delete the original problematic board
fields.summary: When a custom field is configured as the Estimation Statistic, it is no longer available to add to the Issue Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pull Request in Jira display incorrect user as the Author when the actual Author is disabled in Gitlab.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Jira with GitLab by following the steps in [Integrating Jira with GitLab|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/integrating-jira-with-gitlab-1019398724.html] documentation.
# Create a *new user* in GitLab.
# As the *new user*, create a *new Merge Request* in *GitLab* that is associated with a Jira Issue.
# Ensure that the *Pull Request* in Jira is mapped to the correct {{AUTHOR}} (the new user).
# *Disable* the new user in GitLab. (i) Disabled user appear as "Blocked User" in Gitlab instead of the Full Name.
# As an Admin in Gitlab, *Edit* the *Merge Request* created by the disabled user.
# Verify if the Pull Request in Jira mapped to the actual {{AUTHOR}}.

h3. Expected Results
Pull Request in Jira contain the correct Author:
* !correctauthor.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The actual Author is still mapped correctly in the actual actual *Merge Request* in GitLab however, the Pull Request in Jira contain the incorrect Author:
* !wrongauthor.png|thumbnail!

The actual Author become the reviewer for the Pull Request in Jira:
* !wrongreviewermapping.png|thumbnail!

Upon further inspection from Jira Database, the AUTHOR column inside AO_E8B6CC_PULL_REQUEST table is updated to a random GitLab user name after the user is disabled in GitLab causing the wrong mapping. 

h3. Workaround
Update the AUTHOR column with the actual Full Name of the disabled user:
{code}
UPDATE "AO_E8B6CC_PULL_REQUEST" SET "AUTHOR" = '<replace_with_gitlab_user_full_name>' where WHERE ID = <pull_request_id>;
{code}
fields.summary: Jira Integration with GitLab wrong user assigned to the Author of a Pull Request when the actual Author is disabled in GitLab.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

_As an admin or member of the team, I would like to be able to view and manage the backlog in the Jira Mobile app._
h3. Suggested Solution

_Add a Backlog section to the Jira Mobile App, much like in the Jira Cloud Mobile App, or even as a column in the board._
h3. Why This Is Important
 * _As an administrator, I get a notification when a new issue is created.  The issue is, according to best practices, sent straight to the backlog.  Since I cannot see the issue in any way on the app, the notification is not very useful, and I have to go to the computer to see or respond to the issue creation._
 * _For some teams, the Scrum Master is not the only one managing the Backlog.  Whether in Backlog Grooming sessions as a group, or simply managing the Backlog as a best practice, day-to-day, this functionality is needed to keep the whole team aligned._ 

h3. Workaround

_1) Access the backlog on the web, through a browser, instead._

_2) Disable the built-in backlog and enable a custom column for backlog in the Kanban.  This defeats much of Jira's built-in functionality for Backlogs, however._
fields.summary: Backlog on Jira Server Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Many users have the same email address. The first user is inactive and does not have application access. Incoming email handler (Jira software) does not check the user is inactive and triggers the error below when trying to create a ticket from this email.

"Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a Jira application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 Create users as shown below. See the first one is inactive and does not have application access.
 !image-2021-05-03-21-41-02-368.png|thumbnail!
 # Step 2
 Send an email from user's email address to Incoming mail handler mailbox.

h3. Expected Results

User is inactive so mail handler should not check if user has application access or not. A ticket should be created.
h3. Actual Results

Incoming mail handler check the inactive user that has no application access
 !image-2021-05-03-21-38-07-229.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Remove email address from the inactive user so incoming mail handler does not map and check that user account.

h3. Not on resolution
The problem is not a Jira bug, see related KBs covering the problem:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Mail+handler+fails+to+create+issue+from+certain+email+addresses+in+Jira+server
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-incoming-mail-handler-processes-the-email-using-an-incorrect-user-968684632.html
fields.summary: Incoming Email handler does not check user is inactive when mapping incoming email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*Caused by: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: JsonObjectCaused by: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: JsonObject at com.google.gson.JsonElement.getAsString(JsonElement.java:191) at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.bitbucket.clientlibrary.model.repository.pullrequest.BitbucketPullRequestActivityEnvelopeDeserializer.deserialize(BitbucketPullRequestActivityEnvelopeDeserializer.java:46)*

*java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: JsonObject* is thrown by BitbucketPullRequestActivityEnvelopeDeserializer when it fails to deserialize the pull request endpoint payload:

[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/activity]

It parses the "pull_request" object and then attempts to find either one of the following json objects: "comment", "approval", or "update".

If it fails to find either of these json objects then it throws the above exception.
h3. Replication steps
 * Create a Pull Request with an approver
 * Approver sets status to 'Changes Requested'
 * DVCS syncs Pull Request

h4. Expected Result

DVCS ignores pull request activity type for `changes_requested`
h4. Actual result

DVCS fails with pull request activity type for `changes_requested`
h3. Workaround

None yet
h3. Suggested Fix

Handle missing data correctly rather than throwing an exception.

Also suggest we add more logging to diagnose the potential source of the issue as currently we can't tell what the contents of the payload from Bitbucket is.
fields.summary: DVCS bitbucket cloud pull request endpoint fails to parse

 # Open the article

If the documentation is referencing an error, then it should suggest all potential known causes and solutions

It only suggests one solution, which is not applicable to all cases

Customers need to contact support to resolve this rather trivial issue

fields.description: I'm a team member and admin of my team's boards, but I cannot create a post function unless I'm administrator of the ENTIRE Jira INSTANCE!  The current global admins are unwilling to allow/maintain post functions so an entire feature set of the product is going to go UNUSED.  If you didn't require FULL ADMIN capability but could enable either individual users or board admins or some level of permission less than global to add post functions in a team's workflow, that would be pretty awesome.  There are over 15,000 users in our instance and I can understand the reluctance of the small admin team to open the flood gates to everyone if they're the only one's who can do it.  Nor will they assign me global admin rights.  This is a severe limitation of a capability that should be out-of-the-box easy for anyone to use.

In some situation, subtasks of Kanban backlog  may turn to all expanded, though they have been collapsed.

All subtasks keep collapsed.

h3. Problem

_Jira Datacenter is not supported officially on Amazon Web Services Fargate._
h3. Suggested Solution

_Test & document process for deploying Jira DC on Fargate, much as we have done for EC2 or Docker, similar platforms._
h3. Why This Is Important

_Serverless containers are becoming more and more popular and, as in the case of Fargate, often mean a reduction in operating costs._
h3. Workaround

_Jira DC can likely be deployed successfully on Fargate, given that Jira DC can be deployed on Docker containers and in the Amazon cloud in general, but no process is documented or supported._
fields.summary: Jira DC - Support for AWS Fargate

fields.description:
h3. Problem
 * When making an API call using a 'value' for a custom field, that value is handled with case-sensitive matching
 ** 'abc123' != 'ABC123'
 * In Jira, custom field single- and multi-select values are handled with case-insensitive matching.
 ** 'abc123' = 'ABC123'

Thus, an API call using 
{noformat}
"customfield_10101":{"value":"abc123"}{noformat}
 will fail (400 error) and unhelpfully return 
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"customfield_10101":"Option id 'null' is not valid"}}%{noformat}
(unhelpful because _value_ is being used here, not _id_, and the problem is the value match/case sensitivity, not the lack of id)
h3.  Suggested Solution

_The desired behavior would be for API calls to handle case the same way Jira does; case-insensitively match ABC123 to abc123._
h3. Why This Is Important
 * _While the solution is to simply write API calls to use the exact desired value, the current behavior is still inconsistent, and this inconsistency prevents certain workarounds (see below Workaround section)_
 * _Users coming from other platforms expect this case-insensitive behavior_

h3. Workaround

_The main reason this is important is because there isn't really a workaround._ 

_If you want to add abc123 & ABC123 both as options in the select list, which would be a workaround for the API call sensitivity in some cases, you will be prevented from 'creating a duplicate.'_ 

!caseInsensitive GUI.png|width=592,height=319!

_The only solution is to be aware of the inconsistent case-sensitivity and to use exactly the matching value._
fields.summary: REST API values should be case-insensitive to match other Jira functionality

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In *upgraded* instances of Jira *Server* 8.15 and 8.16, it is possible to uninstall or disable Advanced Roadmaps. If we do this, however, Jira Software is automatically disabled, and must be re-enabled in the {{pluginstate}} table of the database.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade an instance of Jira Software from an earlier version (e.g., 8.5) to Jira 8.15 or 8.16
 # Disable or uninstall Advanced Roadmaps

h3. Expected Results

Advanced Roadmaps will be disabled or uninstalled without any impact on other applications.
h3. Actual Results

Jira Software is disabled, and cannot be re-enabled via the UI. It must be re-enabled with the following query:
{code:sql}
update pluginstate
set pluginenabled = 'true' where pluginkey LIKE 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-software-application';{code}
Attempts to re-enable Jira Software via the UI do not throw any error messages in the logs, but only give the message 'An unexpected error occurred. Refer to the logs for more information.'

If we re-enable Jira Software, Advanced Roadmaps will also be re-enabled automatically.
h3. Workaround

If we want to hide the app from users, t is possible to remove users' permissions in Advanced Roadmaps, or to remove the license without impacting Jira Software.
fields.summary: Disabling or Uninstalling Advanced Roadmaps Disables Jira Software

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Multiple ellipsis will appear when entering a version field, but not making changes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enter enough version labels in the 'Fix Version/s' field so that it has to show the "..." at the end to indicate there is more to display. (Making the browser window thinner will help with this.)
# Click on the '...' in the 'Fix Version/s' field to expand the field.
# Click in the field as though you are going to edit the field so that the versions appear as lozenges/labels.
# Make no changes to the field, just click out of it to cancel the edit.

h3. Expected Results
The field should return to normal with just one set of ellipses in the field.

h3. Actual Results
The more you repeat the steps above, the more ellipses will appear at the end of the field.

There are no entries in the logs in relation to this bug. This behaviour has been see in the latest versions of Firefox, Chrome-based browsers (MS Edge, Chromium), and Safari.

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the page will return the field back to normal. This appears to be a visual bug only.
fields.summary: Extra ellipsis are created when edit "Fix Version/s" field is entered to edit, and then cancelled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Until [JSWSERVER-20910|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-20910] is introduced, our customers could use a healthcheck warning thrown when there are more than one Rank field in the instance. 

Third-party tools can import multiple Rank fields which can have havoc over indexing performance. Introduction of a new rank field might go unnoticed by administrators as this is not a visible field on the issue view. So administrators might not be aware of this newly introduced Rank field until it's _too late_. 

h3. Suggested Solution

A Jira healthcheck warning can proactively let the admins know that they have multiple Rank fields and this can potentially impact indexing performance.
A "Fix" button should check if the non-default Rank field(s) is/are being used in any of the filters and if not delete the Rank field. 

h3. Workaround 

Manually check if there are more than 1 Rank field in the [Lexorank Management page |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-lexorank-938847803.html] on the Jira UI (_esp. after a project import_) and if you see more than one Rank field, follow this kb to [Manually Remove duplicate Rank fields in Jira server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/remove-duplicate-rank-fields-in-jira-server-779159223.html] 
(!) Keep in mind deleting the Rank field doesn't delete the Rank data from the *AO_60DB71_LEXORANK* table. Ref: [JSWSERVER-13098: JIRA Agile doesn't delete rank from table when the Custom Field was deleted|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13098]
fields.summary: Introduce Jira Healthcheck warning to identify multiple Rank fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In today's average instance size of Jira Data Center having the capability to create more than one Rank field is not a good idea. Having more than one rank field  is generally not useful and causes heavy performance issues like Reindexing becoming very slow etc.

Multiple Third-party plugins ( viz., [Botronsoft - Configuration Manager for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211611/configuration-manager-for-jira?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]) can introduce new Rank without active knowledge of customers followed by major performance impact on Lock and Reindexing due to {{rankInitially}} and {{backoff}} mechanism. Also, it can cause issues such as not being able to re-rank issues on Agile boards. 

This feature was introduced as per [JSWSERVER-3723|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-3723]. 
We should also update the related KB [Changing a Rapid Board Rank field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-a-rapid-board-rank-field-779158970.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
There should be just one Rank field (Default). User or third-party import tools shouldn't be able to create any new Custom field of "Global Rank" Type.

h3. Workaround 
Please check your [Lexorank Management page |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-lexorank-938847803.html] on the Jira UI and if you see more than one Rank field, follow this kb to [Manually Remove duplicate Rank fields in Jira server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/remove-duplicate-rank-fields-in-jira-server-779159223.html]
fields.summary: Remove the ability to have multiple Rank Fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira allows users to manage sprints in circumstances that they should not be to do so.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # With *User A* (that is not a Jira Administrator) create a board (*Original Board*) with a filter query that is comprised of two different projects, let's say *project in (A,B)*.
 # Do not share the filter query for the Original Board with anyone.
 # Create a sprint on this board and only include issues from project A.
 # Create a second board, let's call it *Secondary Board*, using the *Board from an existing project* option, and select *only project A*.
 # Remove *User A's* *Manage Sprints* permission from project B. Ensure that *User A* has the *Browse Projects* permission in *project B*.
 # Attempt to close the sprint with *User A*. This user will be unable to close the sprint and the *You need the manage sprint permission for all projects in the origin board to manage this sprint*.
 # Create a secondary user: *User X* and add this user to the same user management groups and project roles, ensuring that he has the same permissions as user A in both projects.
 # Attempt to close the same sprint.

h3. Expected Results
* *User B* will not be able to complete the sprint, displaying a similar behavior to *User A*.

h3. Actual Results
* *User B* can complete the sprint without any issues, as we can see in the screenshot below:

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-09 at 21.17.37.png|thumbnail! 

 (!) If you share the filter query of the *Secondary Board* with *User B* he will lose the ability to complete the sprint as well.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior, other than creating the sprint directly in the *Secondary Board*.
fields.summary: Jira allows users to Manage Sprints even when they lack permissions in the original board.

We need to offer the language selection prior to the Jira Login page. As of now the users need to login in order to change or select their preferred language, which is counter intuitive to them being able to view the login page in their preferred language(If it is different then the selected global language).

A possible solution to the above would be to prompt the user for preferred language prior to the loading of the Jira main/login page.
fields.summary: User Language Selection

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- Different nodes in JDC is reporting different numbers of licensed users
- There's no recognizable pattern to this behaviour in terms of nodes.
- Generally, one or two nodes will report a number close to the DB query:
{code:java}
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT u.lower_user_name)
FROM   cwd_user u
       JOIN cwd_membership m
         ON u.id = m.child_id
            AND u.directory_id = m.directory_id
       JOIN licenserolesgroup lrg
         ON Lower(m.parent_name) = Lower(lrg.group_id)
       JOIN cwd_directory d
         ON m.directory_id = d.id
WHERE  d.active = '1'
       AND u.active = '1'
    AND license_role_name = 'jira-software';
{code}
while rest of the nodes will be reporting vastly different number.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
There is no observed pattern around this and we have not been able to reproduce it locally.

h3. Expected Results

All the nodes should show same number of license being consumed by user.

h3. Actual Results

 !Screenshot 2021-04-08 at 9.16.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

- Use the DB query above to get the result.
- Generate a directory/user/group level event that eventually rebuilds the cache with that number. For example create a dummy user. Even the directory syncing would calculate the number.
fields.summary: Version and Licenses page shows difference in licensed user count across nodes in DC

h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you include sub-tasks in a set of issues that will be part of a bulk edit operation, Jira should display a validator that prevents you from editing the Epic Link field by displaying the following message:

However, this validator will fail intermittently, allowing users to trigger such operation.

h3. Summary
After recently migrating from Jira Cloud to Server or Data Center, unable to add new users as Jira software board administrator via board settings, the following error is thrown:

+*Error*+:
 _"Ug" is not a valid user._

This is caused by the data set introduced in Cloud: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-20732

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Have a Cloud instance with users created around Sep~Oct 2020;
* Export an XML Backup from this instance and migrate to Server
* Try to add a new user as a board admin in any Jira software board;
*  Jira will throw *"Ug" is not a valid user.* error (x)
* Querying the app_user table looking for that user lower_user_name we should find the following:
||ID||user_key||lower_user_name||
|11054|ug:1287e681-a24c-44ec-bac7-e72ad966a9a2|psouza|

h3. Expected Results

Jira should either convert those user_keys to the Data Center pattern during the export/import, or have the same bug fix implemented that will work with those 'ug:' user_keys.

h3. Actual Results

The following error message is seen upon adding a user:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

It is possible to workaround this issue following the KB article:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/ug-is-not-a-valid-user-error-while-adding-user-as-a-board-admin-1047554310.html

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue is estimated and assigned to a version, if the issue is closed without being assigned for any sprint, it is incorrectly listed under one of the active sprints at the "Release Burndown" report.

This is a scope change and it should not be listed with the other planned issues for the sprint. The ideal is to list it under a separate section as an unplanned item.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * At the Admin> Applications> Jira Software configuration, check the option "Parallel Sprints"
 * Have a project and board
 * Define a Version for the Project "release1"
 * Create Sprint 1 and Sprint 2
 * Create some estimated Stories A, B, C, D and assign all of them to fix version "release1"
 * Assign Story A to sprint 1 and start this Sprint
 * Assign Story B to sprint 2 and start this Sprint
 * On Sprint 1, complete issue A
 * Observe the Report "Release Burndown" - It will incorrectly report the issue under "Sprint 2" (bug JSWSERVER-12616)
 * On Sprint 2, complete issue B
 * Observe the Report "Release Burndown" - It will show both issues under "Sprint 2" (bug JSWSERVER-12616)
 * On Backlog, edit issue C and complete it

h3. Expected Results

Issue "C" reported as completed but not assigned to any specific Sprint
h3. Actual Results

Issue "C" was incorrectly showed under "Sprint 2", but Issue "C" was never planned for this sprint.
h3. Workaround

Add validation to not allow an estimated issue that belongs to a Release to be closed without being assign to a sprint first.
fields.summary: Release Burndown is reporting an estimated issue closed without being assigned to a sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading Jira to 8.14.x, there are duplicated repositories, commits, pull requests showing in the Development panel from the issues.

When checking the database, we confirm data is duplicated as well:
{code:sql}
SELECT 
    om.name AS "Org Name"
    , rm.name AS "Repo Name"
    , rm.slug
    , rm.organization_id
    , rm.fork
    , rm.deleted
    , rm.last_commit_date
FROM AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING rm, AO_E8B6CC_ORGANIZATION_MAPPING om
WHERE om.id = rm.organization_id AND rm.NAME = '<repo-name>';
{code}
(!) Affects GitHub accounts only.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Steps to Reproduce
- Upgrade to Jira 8.14
- Set up a DVCS integration with Github
- Commit to repository
- Github Webhook automatically pings DVCS and syncs
- Click on Issues > Development panel, the commits will show twice:
 !image-2021-03-30-11-35-36-647.png|width=414,height=193!

h3. Expected Results

Repositories commits pull requests to appear once
h3. Actual Results
GitHub does not fetch the correct organization as it was based on the host URL - which for multiple orgs is the same. Thus some organizations end up with duplicated repositories. 
 !image-2021-03-30-11-35-36-647.png|width=414,height=193!

Repositories are duplicated in the database as well.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Duplicate branches commits, and pull requests when synching Jira with GitHub

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

An XML backup contains a list of issues (ID, key), issue link types, issue links (issuelinktype id, and issue id), and {{entity_property}} rows.

Jira issue links are stored in the {{issuelink}} table and link two issues via their issue ID.

Portfolio/Advanced Roadmaps for Jira provides a "parent link" issuelinktype which is sometimes uses to link issues. However, primarily it uses a json key {{parent_id}} in the issue's {{entity_property}}

Both the entity property {{parent_id}}, and the {{issuelink}} (ARJ and non-ARJ) are stored as issue ID's, not keys.

When the XML Project Import runs, it resolves the old issue ID's to the newly created issue ID's, because it has knowledge of the issue key within the backup XML, which results in links based on Jira Issue Link system being resolved, and therefore showing as expected once the project is imported. 

It does not however consider ARJ's {{entity_property}} {{parent_id}} in it's import process, which results in the "parent link" field not being migrated correctly with the project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test software project
 # Create a test issue of type Epic
 # Create a test issue of type Bug
 # Under Hierarchy Configuration in Advanced Roadmaps for Jira (ARJ), add the "Bug" issue type as the top level in the hierarchy
 # Make a new Plan in ARJ
 # Move the Epic issue "under" the Bug issue, then commit changes. You should see the change reported is adding the parent link
 # Perform a XML Backup
 # Delete the test project
 # Using Project Import, choose the XML backup file
 # Select the TEST project

h3. Expected Results
 # When viewing the ARJ plan, the Epic issue is listed below/under (aka linked) the BUG issue type
 # When viewing the issues in Jira Issue Navigator, the "Parent Link" field of the Epic issue is populated with the Bug issue. (as expected)
 # When you check the database, you find that the {{parent_id}} field was has been changed to the newly imported Bug issue ID

h3. Actual Results
 # When viewing the ARJ plan, the Epic issue is NOT listed below/under the BUG issue type (AKA, the link is lost)
 # When viewing the issues in Jira Issue Navigator, the "Parent Link" field is not populated. It is blank. 
 # When you check the database, you find that the {{parent_id}} field was not mapped to the newly imported Bug issue ID, instead, it's listed as the id of the issue before it was deleted

h3. Workaround
 * Export the desired issues to CSV beforehand
 * After the project import is completed, import the "Parent Link" custom field to resolve the links correctly
fields.summary: Import Project from XML backup does not migrate the Portfolio/Roadmaps parent link field

h3. Expected Results
Since the user cloning the Story doesn't have appropriate edit permission on the Epic Link (Epic issue) the entire operation should fail. 

Alternatively, Jira should:
* Throw clearer error message with something like e.g., "{{Failed to clone <EPIC LINK> due to insufficient permission on linked epic}}"
* NOT create workflow inconsistency on the cloned issue 

h3. Actual Results
* (flag) The _incorrectly-cloned-issue_ (ABCD-14) is still created and no workflow transitions available:
 !2021-03-04_22-28-38.png|thumbnail! 
* Error on UI: {color:red}{{admin.errors.exception com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException: You do not have permission to edit the following issues: ABCD-11, ABCD-14.}}{color}
 !2021-03-04_22-24-30.png|thumbnail! 
* Error in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code}
2021-03-04 16:40:12,079+0000 JiraTaskExecutionThread-3 ERROR user1 1000x1006x1 d789vb 172.29.213.55 /secure/CloneIssueDetails.jspa [c.a.j.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException: You do not have permission to edit the following issues: ABCD-11, ABCD-14.
com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException: You do not have permission to edit the following issues: ABCD-11, ABCD-14.
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:522)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssueObject(DefaultIssueManager.java:616)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.RequestCachingIssueManager.createIssueObject(RequestCachingIssueManager.java:212)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.CloneIssueCommand.call(CloneIssueCommand.java:133)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.CloneIssueCommand.call(CloneIssueCommand.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:533)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:491)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:216)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException: You do not have permission to edit the following issues: ABCD-11, ABCD-14.
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.createIssue(OSWorkflowManager.java:780)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:513)
	... 11 more
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: You do not have permission to edit the following issues: ABCD-11, ABCD-14.
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkCFType.ensureEpicAssignment(EpicLinkCFType.java:728)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkCFType.createValue(EpicLinkCFType.java:56)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.createValue(ImmutableCustomField.java:693)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.IssueCreateFunction.execute(IssueCreateFunction.java:84)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.executeFunction(AbstractWorkflow.java:1014)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1407)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.createIssue(OSWorkflowManager.java:754)
	... 12 more
{code}

h3. Workaround

h4. Without changing the permissions:
* Through DB:
** Identify cloned issue's workflow integrity:
{code:sql}SELECT jiraissue.id issue_id,
       jiraissue.workflow_id, 
       os_wfentry.* 
FROM   jiraissue
JOIN   os_wfentry
ON     jiraissue.workflow_id = os_wfentry.id
WHERE  os_wfentry.state IS NULL 
OR     os_wfentry.state = 0
AND jiraissue.id = <CLONED_ISSUE_ID>;{code}
** UPDATE if state is 0 with:
{code:sql}UPDATE os_wfentry SET state = 1 WHERE id = <CLONED_ISSUE_ID>;{code}
OR
* DB Integrity checker for workflow intergrity and Fix all the errors
OR
* Change the issue type of the Clone issue to something else and then change it back to previous issuetype (only works if multiple issue types share the same workflow)
OR
* Move the issue to a different Project and move it back to previously intended project

h4. Change Permissions:
* Allow the users with "Edit issue" permission
OR
* Remove "Create issue" permission for the group of users who shouldn't clone Stories

h3. Notes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When story points are assigned to new stories at the story creation screen, this does not generate an audit history item capturing the story point assignments. This causes problem down the road, if that story is spilled over to next sprints, which would make the original sprint not showing any story points at all, and the burndown chart will all be changed because of that _after_ the sprint is completed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a story A and assign its story points (say, 10) at the issue creation screen. Note that the history won't reflect the story point assignment action.
# Create a story B, save it, and then assign its story points (say, 5) as a separate action. Note that the history will reflect the story assignment with the timestamp and all.
# Create a story C and assign its story point however you want (say, 3)
# Assign all 3 stories to a new sprint and start it.
# Note that sprint has a total committed value of 18 points (10+5+3).
# Complete story C. The burndown chart will reflect this (18 -> 15).
# Complete the sprint, and story A and story B to a new sprint.
# Start the new sprint. It should have 10+5 = 15 story points.
# Check the Sprint Report for the original sprint - it still shows 18 -> 15, story A and B are listed in "Not completed" section, their story points are reflected correctly. Everything looks good.
# Now in the new sprint, change the story points for Story A to "12"
# Next, change the story point for story B to "6".
# Open up Sprint Report for the original sprint again. It will now show that story A has no points, and story B has 5 points. The total burndown numbers have changed (8 -> 5), e.g. 10 points from story A are now gone.

h3. Expected Results

Completed sprints should be reflecting correct historical data. 

h3. Actual Results

Completed sprints show incorrect data.

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, do not assign story points at the issue creation screen, always assign them after the issue is created as a separate action.
fields.summary: Completed sprints show no story points for stories that had them assigned at creation time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pop up with *gh.boards.kanplan.enable.inlinedialog.title* title gets populated on Kanban Board when board has 20+ issues in its backlog.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create minimum 20 stories/issues on a Kanban project.
 # Create a Kanban Board. Make sure the 20+ issues appear in the Kanban board by using the appropriate filter.
 # Map the status of the issues/stories to *Backlog* in the created Board.
 # Go to Board > Configure > Swimlanes. Change it to *Stories*.
 (i) This is optional. The issue replicated without this step also.

h3. Expected Results

Issues are displayed in *Backlog* column of Kanban board.
 !Screenshot 2021-03-10 at 4.33.32 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Issues are displayed in *Backlog* column of Kanban board. We also see a popup with *gh.boards.kanplan.enable.inlinedialog.title* with other details that does not make sense and are not required.
 !Screenshot 2021-03-10 at 4.35.04 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

You could 'enable' dedicated space for Kanban Backlog when there are multiple issues/stories on backlog.
 # Go to *Board* > *Configure* > *Columns*.
 # Drag issues from *Backlog* to *Kanban backlog*.
 !Screenshot 2021-03-10 at 4.46.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 after dragging:
 !Screenshot 2021-03-10 at 4.46.39 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Go back to board. You will not see *Backlog* on Kanban board. However, there will be a separate *Backlog* section for the board where issues will be displayed.
 !Screenshot 2021-03-10 at 4.48.01 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 There are no errors/pop-up observed here.

h3. Workaround 2
{panel}
Try adding below code in Announcement Banner
{code:java}
<style type="text/css">
.aui-inline-dialog.jira-help-tip.aui-help.js-kanplan-enable-inline-dialog { 
  display: none !important;
}
</style>
{code}
 * Go to the cog in the top right-hand corner of Jira.
 * Select"System".
 * Type ". Announcement" OR scroll down the left hand menu to the "User Interface" and select "Announcement Banner".
 * Paste code above into the Announcement field.
 * Select Visibility of "Private".
 * Click on *Set Banner*.{panel}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there are connection issues between Jira and Bamboo during real-time or background sync process, the development panel can become corrupt and all Jira issues that have Bamboo build info associated with them will be missing from the development panel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a build to an issue
# Deploy the build
# Interrupt the application link by stopping Bamboo or by other methods

h3. Expected Results
The application link would gracefully handle the loss of connection and refresh the cache once the connection is restored

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
Caesium-1-3 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.p.devstatus.provider.DefaultDevSummaryPollService] Refresh failure
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DataProviderRefreshFailure: Data Provider [Id: 72eefabd-9fb6-35c2-a401-671d06c58b00, Type: bamboo] refresh failed with error code -1 and message - timeout after 10000ms, not getting from cache]
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DefaultCachingProviderHelper.refreshProvider(DefaultCachingProviderHelper.java:78)
{noformat}
After some time, the poll service stops and the {{AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY}} cache becomes stale -- the result is that all Bamboo build info will be missing from the development panel in the Jira issues.

h3. Workaround

Use the query below to delete the development information in the issue:
{code:sql}
--Query for Postgresql
DELETE
FROM "AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY"
WHERE "AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY"."JSON" LIKE '%ISSUE-123%';
{code}

{code:sql}
--Query for other DB engines
DELETE
FROM AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY
WHERE AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY.JSON LIKE '%ISSUE-123%';
{code}

When accessing the issue again, Jira will recreate the entry in the database and will show the correct information.
fields.summary: Development panel breaks if Bamboo is unreachable during sync process

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Due to this bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-20866 , when performing the workaround which is to run Background or project re-index, the subtask only re-appears on the node where is was executed on.

This is only affecting boards which has the Advance Roadmaps' Team Field
h3. Environment

Tested on :
 Jira version 8.13.3 , 8.14.0
 Advance Roadmaps version : 3.29.5
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) Steps to reproduce below are using a 2 node JDC environment

# Verify that you are running into the bug from JSWSERVER-20866 where the board's filter includes a teams field from Advance Roadmaps. Then first run a full-reindex. This will remove the teams field from the index. 
# Run project re-index on Node 1. Subtask is now visible on Node 1's board
# Check node 2

h3. Expected Results
Running the project re-index on Node 1 will trigger the Proect re-index on Node 2 and the subtask should now be visible on Node 2

h3. Actual Results
Project re-index is triggered on Node 2 but the Subtask is not visible on Node 2's board

# Run project re-index on Node 2. Subtask is now visible on Node 2's board
# Check Node 1, issue occurs there again.
# Running project re-index or background re-index on Node 1 fixes this issue in Node 1 but checking Node 2, its happening there again.

Screen recording : [^kanbanboard.mp4]

h3. Workaround

# Add this system property to disable filtering indexers by value ( [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html] )
{code}
-Djira.cfv.driven.indexing.disabled=true
{code}
(i) You can learn more about this property from  [Optimizing custom fields |https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/optimizing-custom-fields-1005343684.html#Optimizingcustomfields-HowdoIdisablethisfeature]
# Restart Jira
# Perform a full re-index.
fields.summary: Background or project re-index changes for Team Field for subtask is not replicated to other nodes

Two Dimensional issue Filter gadget shows Wrongs values when the filter has Subtasks and Teams Portfolio field in the Y-Axis

2) Create a project with 3 issues (let's say issue type = Tasks) and select one Team while creating the Tasks from the Team custom field.

4) Now create an issue Filter something like below

You should be able to see three issues. 

5) Now create a Two Dimensional Issue filter gadget in your dashboard and have the configuration similar to this
Saved filter = 2D Filter
X-Axis = Any Custom/System Field of your choice (Let's say, Reporter)
Y-Axis = Team
Sort Direction and Number of Results can be left as Default
Save the settings. 

We notice that the sub-tasks issues are counted under the "None" section. Even though we have values under them. 

h3. Expected Results
The gadget shows the right number of issues under their respective Teams.

h3. Actual Results

We notice that the sub-tasks issues are counted under the "None" section. Even though we have values under them. 

I am attaching the screenshots for reference

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Missing advance conditional triggers related to Bitbucket branch creation, branch merging , etc when using Automation for Jira. 

The use case for us and I think everyone using triggers is that developers want thing to happen automatically based on code commits, branch creation, branch merging, and all other types of bitbucket activity when issue keys are linked to committed code to avoid unnecessary overhead of having to go into Jira and remember to make changes there as well. I am under the impression this is the only reason that triggers exist in the first place so it's not like this is a unique thing on our end.

Unfortunately the only thing "missing" here in terms of feature request for triggers is that they are not flexible and cannot be conditioned in any way, which makes them essentially useless for any more complex scenarios requiring nuance such as our desired behavior below to only trigger IF meeting condition X. If a4j could incorporate all of these native triggers but allow for that nuance, that would be VERY valuable.

[!_thumb_5719363.png|thumbnail!|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/5719363/5719363_image.png]

 
h2. Possible Workaround 
 # Create an A4J rule with an “Issue Transitioned” and selecting the specific transition;
 # On that rule verify if we have the custom field as expected;
 # If the custom field is not set as we’ve expected, we can transition it back to the initial status.
fields.summary: Add Bitbucket conditional triggers for Jira Automation and Jira
